words.etymology_text: From Latin clāra, probably through one or more European languages.
Klemo + -la, originally the name of a farm, derived from the same origin as the given name Klemetti.

words.etymology_text:
Medieval form of the Latin saint's name Clemens, cognate with English Clement.
* Klemetti and its variant forms were possibly confused with, or used as a Christian forms of, the ancient Finnish name Lemmitty, Lemmetty.

words.etymology_text: A name invented by Finnish translators, from dialectal klonkku (“lame, clumsy”), probably from lonkata (dialectally also klonkata).

examples.text:
—Mä katson vain kuvat, vastasi poika. Mä sain tämän lehden lainaan yläkerran Klaussilta, sillä aikaa kun se pelaa pihassa.
—Jaa, vai niin, sanoi Saara ja ajatteli, että heti niillä on nimetkin eri sorttia, Klaus.

raw_glosses: (geography) A shallow body of fresh or slightly brackish water typical for some coastal regions of the Baltic Sea; a former sea bay which has been separated from the sea in the process of postglacial rebound. Typically it has no catchment basin of any significance, and it gets new water only through direct precipitation or occasionally from the sea when the sea water level is high.
glosses: A shallow body of fresh or slightly brackish water typical for some coastal regions of the Baltic Sea; a former sea bay which has been separated from the sea in the process of postglacial rebound.
